fields.summary: BitBucket: add PR state in PR status change emails

fields.description:
I would like to know if it is possible to have an automated created list where it is possible to manage all the links on every page that have connections from and to other pages/spaces.

An example is when you update the title of a page that this is automatically/can be updated by all the other links that contain this link to that 'changed title' page. Or when you want that all pages that have a link to page A can be replaced to page B without you have to do go manually every page to replace the link.
fields.summary: List of incoming and outgoing links to pages for automatic updates and maintance
Need to have a web portal for MDM Cloud to manage subscriptions
Create a subscription modal for MDM Cloud

fields.description:
I have a personal Cloud account, as well as an account for my employer. Each time I visit one or the other, it complains that I'm logged in under the wrong account.

But they have completely unique hostnames (e.g. latencyzero.atlassian.com, matterport-confluence.atlassian.com). You should either store the auth tokens under separate fully-qualified host names, or do something to let them both stay logged in simultaneously. The current setup is a pain (not to mention that we can't have custom URLs anyway).
fields.summary: Store loging/auth credentials based on full hostname

fields.description: As a G Suite administrator, sometimes I want to keep my users as inactive on JIRA/Confluence even if they are added to my Synced Group. I would like to have the possibility to mark a checkbox in JIRA that will prevent those users to become active once the sync occurs.
fields.summary: G Suite integration: Would like to have an option to keep users inactive in JIRA even if they are added to the synced group

fields.description:
I use bitbucket.org to manage a handful of public open source projects using Mercurial. Particularly with Mercurial's new changeset evolution functionality, I find myself frequently processing pull requests manually (outside of Bitbucket) to keep a clean history. This is fine, but when I push up the final changes (likely a rebase, possibly with some other history manipulation), the pull request doesn't realize that it has been resolved.

A few potential solutions (not mutually exclusive):
 * Recognize when a pull request has been merged, even if the changesets in question have been marked obsolete and superseded.
 * Improve the "rebase --collapse" functionality to allow more control over the metadata of the resulting changeset (author and description).
 * As a last resort, add a "noop" or "external" merge strategy, which can be used to resolve a pull request by confirming that the merge has been completed elsewhere.
fields.summary: Improved interaction between Mercurial pull requests and changeset evolution
Indicate timezone in the "Page unavailable" page

fields.description:
For a few weeks now our users report very slow JIRA Cloud performance. It's especially noticeable from 8am to 2pm PDT. For the record we are located in San Diego, CA, but remote users in other US timezones report performance issues too.

Sometimes the load time is so bad that JIRA reports a "this ticket cannot be viewed right now" error, presumably a 504 wrapper. Last week's performance fixes per status page did not fix anything for us.

We have investigated our own last mile connection and ruled out congestion there. Plus, remote users report the same slow-downs as in-office users.

I'll add that site responsiveness gets a lot better around 4pm PDT and onward, as the rest of North America stops using the service. So it looks like cloud infrastructure overload to me.
fields.summary: JIRA Cloud is very slow lately

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Customers who have JIRA and Confluence integrated with each other would like to share Attachments between each application rather than having to upload them in two different spots

h3. Suggested Solution
Store Attachments in a Central Repository that can be accessed by different Atlassian Applications or allow each application to see each other's attachments
 
h3. Workaround 
- Link the Confluence Page with the Attachments to the corresponding JIRA Issue
- Use a File Storage System (Dropbox, Google Drive, etc) and link to the share in both Confluence/JIRA

The current implementation of SAML SSO in Atlassian Cloud assumes that at least one application is used by all users within an account. Unfortunately this is not the case for us, and probably other customers as well.

For example, our company uses both JIRA Cloud and Confluence Cloud. Some users only have access to JIRA Cloud and others only have access to Confluence Cloud.

But with the SAML configuration options currently on offer we're unable to direct these users to their relevant application directly.

As a result we are forced to choose an application specific home page (in our case JIRA dashboard) as the SSO landing page. So Confluence Cloud only users are inconvenienced by SSO'ing into JIRA cloud and then navigating to Confluence via the Apps Menu.

We're trying to get around the issue but Atlassian Cloud supports one identity provider(IdP) per account so we're unable to create multiple IdP integrations. Multiple IdP integrations would allow us to provide multiple SSO landing pages, one per app.

Solution options include:
 - Creating an app agnostic landing page that all users can access which is not tied to an app per se.
 - Allowing multiple IdP integrations per account.
 - etc.. It's your product so i'll let product dev decide.

Can you please review the issue described above and provide your feedback.
If there is a workaround to this issue can you please provide relevant information.

Thanks

This issue was created in error - please close/delete.

I didn't realise there is already google account integration.  

My mistake - but can't figure out how to close it.

The greatest drawback from getting an enterprise to use Atlassian products, is that the plugin licenses are very costly when you have a large number of users, yet most of those users may not use the plugin.

When you order a plugin, you should be able to specify how many users will have access to that plugin, and then select the users who have access.
fields.summary: Plugins should be licensed by, and only available to, selected users and not entire number of users in instance

fields.summary: This is an Issue for the cloud

fields.description:
h4. Summary of Issue

When JIRA Service Desk Mail Handler processes an email where the body of the email is encoded as *Content-Transfer-Encoding: base64*:

# For a new ticket - the decoded contents are added into Ticket Description (but HTML is also added as an attachment to the ticket)
# For an existing ticket - the decoded contents are added into Ticket Comment (but HTML is also added as an attachment to the ticket)

The behaviour works as expected (no additional attachment) when email body is encoded as *Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable*.

h4. How to reproduce

# Send an email to the JIRA Service Desk listening email address
# Once the email has arrived and processed by JIRA Service Desk
#* Extract out the contents of AO_2C4E5C_MAILITEMCHUNK and decode
#* Update the main body encoding from *Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable* to *Content-Transfer-Encoding: base64*
#* Also encode the actual email body to *base64*
#* Re-encode the whole email as *base64*
#* Re-update into AO_2C4E5C_MAILITEMCHUNK and set AO_2C4E5C_MAILITEM.status to 'NEW' for reprocessing


h4. Expected Result

Email body updated into Ticket Description / Ticket Comment without adding it again as an attachment.


h4. Actual Result

In JIRA Service Desk (for both Server and Cloud):

# For a new ticket - the decoded contents are added into Ticket Description (but HTML is also added as an attachment to the ticket)
# For an existing ticket - the decoded contents are added into Ticket Comment (but HTML is also added as an attachment to the ticket)

h4.Workaround

There is no usability issue as the comment is posted into the ticket appropriately but the redundant attachment is occupying additional disk space.

The work around would be to simply delete the attachment (which has a random 8 character name such as ohecJTek)
fields.summary: Email body encoded as Content-Transfer-Encoding: base64 added as duplicate attachment
Micheli logo out of whack. First two menu item Collections and Engagement display shows as you see. Extra thick grey stripe should not be there above the carousel.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Cloud Customers who have both JIRA and Confluence in a Single Instance would like to use Application Specific Gadgets and Macros in the opposing Application; for example the Confluence Page Gadget on a JIRA Dashboard

Adding External Gadgets is a restricted function within the Cloud Environment; ([Confluence|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/restricted-functions-in-confluence-cloud-734070955.html] and [JIRA|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/restricted-functions-in-jira-cloud-applications-776636921.html])

h3. Suggested Solution
As JIRA and Confluence can exist on the Same Instance, they should not be treated as "external"
fields.summary: Allow External Gadget From Within the Same Cloud Instance

fields.description: We have a big need of being able to hide sub-task from the user group our customers are in. When we spit Stories into sub-tasks, we get very technical, and this is information our customers do not need and should not see, all they need to see is the overall progress of the stories. It would be a great help if the sub-task could be hidden from user groups selected by us.

fields.description:
Customers are currently unable to create or delete users directly from SAML and have the same reflected in Atlassian Cloud. 

Here is an example scenario : 
 # Customer a JIRA administrator and a SAML administrator for his organization has created a user say at SAML and assigned him the JIRA application access
 # Customer expects that user automatically gets synched up to Atlassian Cloud and gets created in Atlassian Cloud with JIRA access
 # But the actual scenario is customer has to create the user and provide access at both SAML and the JIRA Atlassian Cloud separately

Similarly for delete user, if user access is removed from JIRA Application at SAML , he accepts user to also loose access to JIRA application in the instance.
fields.summary: Please provide auto provision and synch of users feature in SAML SSO

fields.description:
Please vote and watch for the specific product feature that peaks your interest -
Confluence - https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-68406
Jira - https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-73341

The "WYSIWYG" editor for Atlassian (and I use quotes to point out that that definition is left up to interpretation) is, to be blunt, awful. The formatting is utterly unpredictable and being able to perform simple markdowns in certain, basic cases is not even possible. For instance, trying to set text to {{preformated}} but only for part of a line is not possible using the GUI. It's either the entire line or nothing. If you attempt to go DIY with markdowns and use braces. this will likely create any number of problems, depending on their proximity to other elements. If you have no other formatting any where near where you are entering text, you can enclose a word or phrase in the double braces and it works, but sometimes the first brace will invoke the macro expectation and you can't get out of it. Sometimes the braces are simply ignored altogether and treated as plain text! Sometimes the end braces are ignored and the remainder of the document is made to be {{preformated!}} I am sure there are other neat mutations of formatting that I have forgotten to mention.

The other big problem is with bulleted or numbered text. I cannot even count the problems that relate to this construct. For instance, sometimes you can do a shift-return inside a numbered list which allows for a multi-line entry under a number or bullet, but this will not work if you attempt to format the lines in some way. Worse, if you attempt to use Undo (command-Z) it will not actually undo what you did, but make to formatting mayhem worse! Of course trying to put a picture element or anything else for that matter in a numbered list makes the list start the numbering over from 1. I have found no way around this.

The long and the short of it is I spend more time trying to format documents than I do writing documents and frankly I don't understand how so many businesses put up with it. I supposed they just make their documents basic or just give up quickly when they try to make something vaguely complex and go with something that looks terrible or doesn't make sense. This is invariably what I do now, but after realizing how much time I waste trying to get Confluence formatting to actually work, I have decided to just put stuff in plain text. But even THAT doesn't work because Confluence attempts to "help" you by trying to turn things like numbers into numbered lists or other gratuitous things that I cannot turn off. It's infuriating.

To put it simply, the editor is intolerable, and when you made it so you can't even create documents in raw text with your own markdown code, you took away the ability to do anything useful. What's worse is that all of the great plugins which are available (and usually free) that would otherwise solve most of these headaches (such as the use of a plain text markdown format editor, for instnace), are simply not supported by Atlassian Cloud! Practically none of the useful plugins for both JIRA or Confluence are permitted on AC at all! I even begged my boss to let me set up our own hosted JIRA and Confluence because it's really not hard to maintain, but he pointed out that migration would be a nightmare, and he was right. We are stuck with being stymied by the limitations of AC.

I have talked to colleagues and they all agree that the Atlasssian editor is a nightmare and has been for years, and that in spite of glaring problems, nothing improves and no one has come up with a work-around, at least not one that works for your cloud-hosted services. For instance, I wanted to use Stillsofts Evernote <-> Confluence Sync but of course AC doesn't support it. Then I just wanted to plain markdown editor. ANY editor would do. The only thing remotely like this cost something like $30/month per seat when there are free plain text markdown editor plugins for your own hosted version of Confluence.

The icing on the cake is that Atlassian's own JIRA instance which I am entering this ticket right now has the ability to enter text in plain text or "Visual" or "Text", the feature I have been so desperately searching for for our own instance. How ironic is it that I can do my own markdowns when entering a ticket to complain about how my instance has no ability to enter my own markdowns. I guess this means that internally, Atlassian staff must realize how awful their own product's editor is, but won't show mercy on your own cloud customers by offering it to them. (Maybe you do, but it appears you charge an arm-and-a-leg for it.

Seriously- either fix the editor once and for all, or allow plugins on Atlassian Cloud where other third parties have fixed your bugs, so customers that are forced by their company's policy to write documentation on their central wiki can retain their sanity. Do it for them, if for anyone. Please.

When exporting issues to CSV, the "Date Started" field does not appear.
 As an admin, I would like to have this field to track the teams time logs.
fields.summary: Export to CSV does not show "Date Started" field

fields.description:
Currently, a few Confluence / JIRA functionalities seem to fill up the browser's local storage, which results in features not working properly.

It would be great to have the localStorage management improved in a way to avoid a potential loss of functionalities until the {{localStorage}} is cleared.

Reference: [Functionality in JIRA and Confluence fail due to Exceeding Chrome Quota|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/functionality-in-jira-fails-due-to-exceeding-chrome-quota-762874705.html]
fields.summary: Improve the localStorage management in Confluence/JIRA.

fields.description: Customers have requested an export option that allows for Confluence content to be readable and searchable at the file system level.
fields.summary: Allow for exporting of Confluence spaces / sites to a zip file for file system backup

fields.description:
h3. Summary

After export issues with time spent correctly filled to CSV format, the time spent column is blank.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Select issues with time tracking enabled.
# Export to CSV and open on Excel/Calc.

h3. Expected Results

Time spent column shows summing of work log entries.

h3. Actual Results

The column is blank.
 
h3. Notes

If export to HTML format, the column shows the correct information.
Tested on a clean instance and the problem is the same.

h3.Workaround
Export to HTML format.
fields.summary: Time Spent field is blank after export to CSV

fields.description:
h3. Summary
There was a feature request regarding choosing default homepage in Atlassian Cloud (Choose JIRA or Confluence) in https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CLOUD-6068 which has been deployed June last year (refer to [this comment|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CLOUD-6068?focusedCommentId=917274&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-917274]; but now the feature is not available anymore

h3. Environment
* Atlassian Cloud


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# go to https://<instance-name>.atlassian.net/admin/apps
# look under User defaults

h3. Expected Results
You will be able to set the default homepage for your site to one of your cloud products.

h3. Actual Results
The configuration is not there

h3. Notes
Refer to the following page for the feature details:
- https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/set-your-site-homepage-873871363.html

h3.Workaround
None at the moment
fields.summary: Unable to choose default homepage anymore in Atlassian Cloud

fields.description:
Can you add on the FAQ the question: 
- What happens to users on the instance that are not on the verified domains on a SAML enabled instance?
- Can they log in using just their Atlassian Account credentials?
- Can we provision accounts to them on instance level and not IDP (Emails without verified domain)

We are not sure of the complete answer for that as well and it would be good to have this on documentation to provide to customers or even to avoid them from having to contact support for these queries.

Documentation:
https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/saml-single-sign-on-873871238.html
